Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Penpara with a black lappet wig, a brown face, the hands are depicted as holding two red hoes, the front of the body is painted white, the legs are inscribed with a central column of worn black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground, the back is painted white and has a red seed-basket.
Curator's comments: Published Kitchen, Ram. Insc. Vol 7 p329
